info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 9:29PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Scurry, northwestern Mitchell, eastern Borden and northeastern Howard Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 929 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles east of Gail, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Snyder, Gail, Fluvanna, J B Thomas Reservoir, Vincent, Randalls Corner, Winston Field and Knapp. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
